metadata.title: CVE-2023-1077 on Ubuntu 24.04 LTS (noble) - medium
metadata.description:
In the Linux kernel, pick_next_rt_entity() may return a type confusedentry, not detected by the BUG_ON condition, as the confused entry will notbe NULL, but list_head.The buggy error condition would lead to a typeconfused entry with the list head,which would then be used as a typeconfused sched_rt_entity,causing memory corruption.

    Update Instructions:

    Run `sudo pro fix CVE-2023-1077` to fix the vulnerability. The problem can be corrected
    by updating your system to the following package versions:

linux-image-6.5.0-9-generic - 6.2.0-18.18
linux-image-unsigned-6.5.0-9-generic - 6.2.0-18.18
linux-image-unsigned-6.5.0-9-generic-64k - 6.2.0-18.18
No subscription required

linux-image-unsigned-6.5.0-1008-aws - 6.2.0-1003.3
No subscription required

linux-image-unsigned-6.5.0-1007-azure - 6.2.0-1003.3
No subscription required

linux-image-unsigned-6.5.0-1007-gcp - 6.2.0-1005.5
No subscription required

linux-image-unsigned-6.5.0-9-lowlatency - 6.2.0-1002.2
linux-image-unsigned-6.5.0-9-lowlatency-64k - 6.2.0-1002.2
No subscription required

linux-image-6.5.0-1005-raspi - 6.2.0-1004.5
No subscription required

criterions.comment: linux package in noble, is related to the CVE in some way and has been fixed (note: '6.2.0-18.18').
linux-aws package in noble was vulnerable but has been fixed (note: '6.2.0-1003.3').
linux-azure package in noble was vulnerable but has been fixed (note: '6.2.0-1003.3').
linux-gcp package in noble was vulnerable but has been fixed (note: '6.2.0-1005.5').
linux-gke package in noble is affected and may need fixing.
linux-ibm package in noble is affected. An update containing the fix has been completed and is pending publication.
linux-lowlatency package in noble, is related to the CVE in some way and has been fixed (note: '6.2.0-1002.2').
linux-oracle package in noble is affected. An update containing the fix has been completed and is pending publication.
linux-raspi package in noble was vulnerable but has been fixed (note: '6.2.0-1004.5').
